sentence.Network_en: He looked theatrically at his watch.

entry.def: Theatrical means relating to the theatre.

example.ex: These are the prizes given for the most outstanding British theatrical performances of the year.
example.tran: 这些奖项将要颁发给本年度英国最杰出的戏剧表演作品。

entry.tran: (行为)夸张的，做作的，戏剧性的
entry.def: Theatrical behaviour is exaggerated and unnatural, and intended to create an effect.

example.ex: In a theatrical gesture Glass clamped his hand over his eyes.
example.tran: 格拉斯做了一个夸张的手势，用一只手将双眼紧紧捂上了。

entry.tran: 盛大的;壮观的;有戏剧效果的
entry.def: Theatrical can be used to describe something that is grand and dramatic, as if it is part of a performance in a theatre.

example.ex: There was a theatrical air about the whole scene which had a great appeal for me...
example.tran: 整个场面很宏大，深深吸引住了我。

example.ex: The clothes were very showy, very theatrical.
example.tran: 那些衣服很艳丽很华美，像戏装一样。

entry.tran: (尤指业余的)戏剧表演，娱乐表演
entry.def: Theatricals are performances of plays and other entertainments, especially when they are done by actors who act as a hobby rather than a profession.

example.ex: I always was good at amateur theatricals.

means.word_mean: 1. in a stagy and theatrical manner;

sentences.sentence: "`I cannot show my face at her house,' he declared theatrically"

auth_sentence.content: Others are wistful, and sometimes theatrically sad.
auth_sentence.res_content: Others are wistful, and sometimes theatrically sad.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Others are wistful, and sometimes theatrically sad.

auth_sentence.content: Emanuel stood up theatrically and gestured toward his seat with open palms.
auth_sentence.res_content: Emanuel stood up theatrically and gestured toward his seat with open palms.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Emanuel stood up theatrically and gestured toward his seat with open palms.
